qas.question: Around what time were the knights and szlachta very similiar?
What was a personal obligation of the szlachtas?

context: <a0_0>Around the 14th century<a0_0/>, there was little difference between knights and the szlachta in Poland. Members of the szlachta had the personal obligation to <a1_0>defend the country<a1_0/> (pospolite ruszenie), thereby becoming the kingdom's most privileged social class. Inclusion in the class was almost exclusively based on inheritance.
